Mutation of sup-tRNA: The anticodon sequence GGA of the serine tRNA gene is mutated to CUA
The anticodon sequence GUA of the tyrosine tRNA gene is mutated to CUA
The anticodon sequence GUA of the tyrosine tRNA gene is mutated to UUA

Amber and ochre suppressor tRNA genes have been generated by using oligonucleotide directed site-specific mutagenesis to change one or two nucleotides in a human serine
tRNA gene.

Amber and ochre suppressor tRNA genes have been generated by using oligonucleotide directed site-specific mutagenesis to change one or two nucleotides in a human serine
tRNA gene.
Using primer-directed mutagenesis on a Xenopus laevis tyrosine tRNA gene can generate an amber suppressor tRNA gene that has a nucleotide change GTA to CTA in the anticodon sequence.
Using site-specific mutagenesis can change the anticodon of a Xenopus laevis tyrosine tRNA gene so that it would recognize ochre codons.
